TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DataProtectionPermissionAttribute extends System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessSecurityAttribute

Attribute.AttributeName: System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Assembly | System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Struct | System.AttributeTargets.Constructor | System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple=true, Inherited=false)

Docs.summary: Allows security actions for to be applied to code using declarative security. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The scope of the declaration that is allowed depends on the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction> value that is used.
The security information declared by a security attribute is stored in the metadata of the attribute target and is accessed by the system at run time. <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermissionAttribute> is used only for declarative security. For imperative security, use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.DataProtectionPermission> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction action) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission CreatePermission() cil managed

Docs.returns: A that corresponds to the attribute.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method should only be called by the security system, never by application code.
At compile time, attributes convert security declarations to a serialized form in metadata. Declarative security data in metadata is created from the permission that this method returns.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data protection permissions.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of the values. The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether data can be encrypted using the class.
Docs.value: if data can be encrypted; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the value is `false`, a <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> occurs when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedData.Protect%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether memory can be encrypted using the class.
Docs.value: if memory can be encrypted; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the value is `false`, a <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> occurs when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedMemory.Protect%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether data can be unencrypted using the class.
Docs.value: if data can be unencrypted; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this value is `false`, a <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> occurs when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedData.Unprotect%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether memory can be unencrypted using the class.
Docs.value: if memory can be unencrypted; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this value is `false`, a <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> occurs when the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedMemory.Unprotect%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.
